category: Member City/Provincial Sports Association Regulations/Article 30 (Disqualification of Executives)
contents: Article 30 (Disqualifications for executives) ① Any person who falls under any of the following items cannot become an executive of a city/provincial sports association. Amended May 29, 2019, October 6, 1, 2021. Persons who are not citizens of the Republic of Korea 2. Persons who fall under any subparagraph of Article 33 of the National Public Officials Act Amended May 10, 3, 2022 A person who commits a crime stipulated in Articles 355 and 356 of the Criminal Act in relation to his/her duties during his/her term of office at a sports organization or city/provincial/city/county/district sports organization specified in subparagraphs (a) to (c) of Article 2, Subparagraph 9 of the Promotion Act. A person who has been sentenced to a fine of 3 million won or more and whose sentence has been confirmed (including those whose sentence has lapsed) Amended on December 26, 2022, 4. Article 2, Subparagraph 9 (a) through (c) of the National Sports Promotion Act Participating in match-fixing that affects the results of games hosted and managed by sports organizations and city/provincial/city/county/district sports organizations, and violating Article 314 of the Criminal Act and Articles 47 to 48 of the National Sports Promotion Act. A person who has committed a prescribed crime and has been sentenced to a fine or greater and whose sentence has been confirmed (including persons whose sentence has lapsed) ​Amended on May 10, 2022, December 26, 2022, 4-2. A person who has committed a crime falling under any of the following items has been sentenced to imprisonment without prison labor or heavier punishment or medical treatment, and the execution of the sentence is completed (including cases where the execution is deemed to have been completed), or the date the execution is exempted, or the execution of the sentence of imprisonment or heavier punishment is completed. A person for whom 20 years have not passed since the date of receiving a suspended sentence or for whom 10 years have not passed since the date on which a fine was confirmed (including persons whose sentence has lapsed) Newly established on December 26, 2022 a. A sexual crime pursuant to Article 2 of the Special Act on the Punishment of Sexual Violence Crimes. Sexual crimes against children and adolescents pursuant to Article 2, Paragraph 2 of the Act on Sexual Protection of Children and Adolescents, 4-3. A person who has committed the crime of injury or assault in Chapter 25 of Part 2 of the Criminal Act against an athlete is sentenced to imprisonment without prison labor or heavier punishment and the execution of the sentence is completed (including cases where the execution is deemed to have been completed) or the date on which the execution is exempted from imprisonment or imprisonment A person for whom 10 years have not passed since the date of suspension of execution of the above sentence (including persons whose sentence has lapsed) Newly established December 26, 5, 2022 Article 2, Subparagraph 9 (a) through (c) of the National Sports Promotion Act A person who falls under any of the following in sports organizations and city/provincial/city/county/district sports organizations. Amended on May 10, 2022. A person who has been subject to disciplinary action higher than suspension of qualifications for sexual misconduct, such as violence or sexual assault. A person who has been subject to disciplinary action of more than one year of suspension for match-fixing, biased decisions, embezzlement, or breach of trust. A person who has received a disciplinary action of suspension or higher and the period has not yet expired. Revised on May 10, 6, 2022. An executive of the relevant member organization at the time when the Board of Directors of the Sports Association designates a member organization (member city/provincial sports association, member sports organization) as a management organization. A person who has not passed five years from the date of designation (including those who were executives up to six months prior to the date of designation) Newly established on October 6, 2021, May 10, 2022, November 17, 2022 ② Relatives of the Chairman (Article 「Civil Act」) (Referring to a relative under Article 777) cannot become an executive officer. ③ National Assembly members, heads of local governments, and local council members cannot become executives. Revised March 30, 2020. ④ Persons who fall under paragraphs 1 and 3 cannot hold any position, such as honorary president or advisor of the city/provincial sports association. [Full revision 2017. 3. 23.]
